metadata.title: CVE-2023-1916 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in tiffcrop, a program distributed by the libtiff package.A specially crafted tiff file can lead to an out-of-bounds read in theextractImageSection function in tools/tiffcrop.c, resulting in a denial ofservice and limited information disclosure. This issue affects libtiffversions 4.x.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1916` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm10
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm10
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm10
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.11+esm10').
